com.client.core.base.workflow.node.conditional

Class Conditional<T extends Traverser>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.client.core.base.workflow.node.conditional.Conditional<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Node<T>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    IsEdit

    public abstract class Conditional<T extends Traverser>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Node<T>
    An abstract type of Node providing a location for business logic to be performed. The business logic should represent a kind of boolean logic, calling either yes(Traverser) if the logic is true, or no(Traverser) if it is false.

    If neither yes(Traverser) or no(Traverser) is called, the workflow will end and no other nodes will be called.

    Beware of calling both yes(Traverser) and no(Traverser), as both forks of the workflow will be executed, i.e. DO NOT do the following: 
      if(businessLogic(tasks)) {
      yes(tasks);
   }

   no(tasks);
